text: The 2011 Soweto Open was a professional tennis tournament played on hard courts. It was the third edition of the tournament which is part of the 2011 ATP Challenger Tour. It took place in Johannesburg, South Africa between 11 and 17 April 2011. All women's doubles semifinal matches had been cancelled by the supervisor, due to heavy rain and flooding. ==ATP singles main draw entrants== ===Seeds=== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- ! width="70"| Country ! width="175"| Player ! Rank1 ! Seed |- | |Anne Keothavong |107 |1 |- | |Petra Cetkovská |125 |2 |- | |Nina Bratchikova |129 |3 |- | |Eva Birnerová |133 |4 |- | |Mandy Minella |137 |5 |- | |Anne Kremer |148 |6 |- | |Corinna Dentoni |149 |7 |- | |Kathrin Wörle |153 |8 |} * Rankings are as of April 4, 2011. ===Other Entrants=== The following players received wildcards into the singles main draw: * Natasha Fourouclas * Lynn Kiro * Zarah Razafimahatratra * Madrie Le Roux The following players received entry from the qualifying draw: * Gally de Wael * Kim Grajdek * Teodora Mirčić * Asia Muhammed ==Champions== ===Singles=== Izak van der Merwe def. Rik de Voest, 6–7(2), 7–5, 6–3 Valeria Savinykh def. Petra Cetkovská, 6–1, 6–3 ===Doubles=== Michael Kohlmann / Alexander Peya def. Andre Begemann / Matthew Ebden 6–2, 6–2 Cancelled due to heavy rain and flooding ==References== ==External links== *Official Website *ITF Search *ATP official site Soweto Open Soweto Open Category:Hard court tennis tournaments Category:Tennis tournaments in South Africa Category:Soweto Open
